snippet: An administrative judge ruled that the Justice Department had violated its own procedures when it suspended Joseph Bottini and James Goeke for their conduct in the corruption trial against Senator Ted Stevens.
abstract: Administrative Judge Benjamin Gutman overturns suspensions of federal prosecutors Joseph Bottini and James Goeke, whom Justice Dept had tried to discipline for failing to turn over evidence that might have helped defense in botched corruption trial against late Sen Ted Stevens; rules that Justice Dept had violated its own procedures, under the Professional Misconduct Review Unit.
lead_paragraph: An administrative judge ruled that the Justice Department had violated its own procedures when it suspended Joseph Bottini and James Goeke for their conduct in the corruption trial against Senator Ted Stevens.

headline.seo: Judge Overturns Suspensions for Stevens Prosecutors
headline.main: Judge Reverses Suspensions of Prosecutors in Stevens Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Reverses Suspensions Of Prosecutors In Stevens Case
